messageBody:
Check out the JUnit FAQ.

If you want to test the exception handling code, then the general approach is this:

1. Simulate throwing the SQLException so that the exception handler is forced to catch it.
2. Verify that the exception handler catches it and handles it as expected.

You need to force an object to throw the particular SQLException you want to throw into the object that is supposed to handle it. Without knowing what those objects are, I can't write a better description of the solution.

Good luck.

So said TungWaiYip <tungwaiyip@...> on 3/3/2003 --------------------
